DOC.detailed_description: Optimal fluid management consider crucial part determine postoperative outcome organ function . Many report focus evaluation fluid responsiveness use various parameter pulse pressure variation ( PPV ) stroke volume variation ( SSV ) derive invasive semi-invasive monitoring . Recently develop , non invasive cardiac output measurement ( NICOM , Cheetah Medical , Portland , OR ) enable continuous cardiac output ( CO ) monitoring attach electrode thorax . Moreover , CO SSV derive NICOM demonstrate predictor fluid responsiveness . Therefore , aim study evaluate stroke volume variation derive NICOM predictor fluid responsiveness neurosurgical patient . In addition , plan reveal inconclusive patient use gray zone approach .
